alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 5:45PM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, mainly from Gazelle and Weed southward on I-5, but also near Hilt and Highway 3 and 96 toward Fort Jones and Klamath River. For the Winter Weather Advisory, south of Hilt to south of Gazelle, including Montague. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
